attributes.action: Allow locking knives to be allowed for general carry daily in the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
139.—(1) Subject to subsections (4) and (5) below, any person who has an article to which this section applies with him in a public place shall be guilty of an offence.

(2) Subject to subsection (3) below, this section applies to any article which has a blade or is sharply pointed except a folding pocketknife.

(3) This section applies to a folding pocketknife if the cutting edge of its blade exceeds 3 inches.  


The important bit is the folding thing. It was determined (there is precedence - Harris v DPP) that a lock knife becomes a fixed bladed knife when the lock is engaged.

It seems very strange that a 3 inch locking pocket knife is now treated in the same regard as a fixed blade knife. They are not "illegal" as such, but you do have to provide a "reasonable reason" for having one in a public place. A non locking folder of 3" is not treated so harshly. As it is a SAFETY decice, a lock is not making a small penknife a weapon in my opinion and it seems very unfair.
